A. The.NMB„Role
The National Association of Educational Broadcasters will continue to
serve in its traditional role as an association of educators and educational
institutions using communications technology, and as a distributor of
cooperatively produced recorded educational materials. The Association
headquarters will take care of the public relations and public information
service, conduct and stimulate research, provide regular legal and advisory
service to the membership, and edit and publish various periodicals, and
reports. It will conduct a continuing program of recruitment and training,
maintain placement service, and, in general, provide educational communications
personnel with a professional home that will nurture and promote their growth.
In addition to carrying on these regular functions, the NAEB proposes
to intensify and accelerate its continuing effort to professionalize educational
broadcasting.
